Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Isis. Legs only. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white (gypsum?) coating. Red-brown Nile silt fabric. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology records date this to the 1st and 2nd centuries AD, but this Isis figure is too fragmentary to date specifically as there are both Ptolemaic parallels from Naukratis (Bailey 2008, 3006, 3007 in the British Museum; and Fitzwilliam Museum Cambridge E.P.233) and Roman parallels from Antinoe and unprovenanced collections (Dunand 1990, nos. 360 and 361; Fisher 1994, no. 816). Isis-Aphrodite anasyrmene, see Roman variants (Dunand 1979, 186-7, no.60). Dunand, F. 1979. Religion Populaire en Égypte Romaine, Leiden. Dunand, F. 1990. Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Catalogue des terres cuites grécoromaines d'Egypte. Paris Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen, Wasmuth.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.174) (Phase 1)
